text:
```    def _process_cleared_orders(self, event):
        if event.event.orders:
            client = boto3.client("kinesis", region_name="eu-west-1")
            orders = [json.dumps(o.__dict__, default=str).encode("utf-8") for o in event.event.orders]
            self._write_logs(client=client, data=orders, write_table="cleared_orders")

    def _process_cleared_orders_meta(self, event):
        orders = event.event
        updated_orders = []
        for order in orders:
            if order.order_type.ORDER_TYPE == OrderTypes.LIMIT:
                size = order.order_type.size
            else:
                size = order.order_type.liability

            if order.order_type.ORDER_TYPE == OrderTypes.MARKET_ON_CLOSE:
                price = None
            else:
                price = order.order_type.price

            order_data = {
                "bet_id": order.bet_id,
                "market_id": order.market_id,
                "selection_id": order.selection_id,
                "trade_id": order.trade.id,
                "date_time_placed": order.responses.date_time_placed,
                "price": price,
                "price_matched": order.average_price_matched,
                "size": size,
                "size_matched": order.size_matched,
                "side": order.side,
                "market_type": order.market_type,
                "elapsed_seconds_executable": order.elapsed_seconds_executable,
                "customer_strategy_ref": order.trade.strategy.name,
                "order_status": order.status.value,
                "market_note": order.trade.market_notes,
                "trade_notes": order.trade.notes_str,
                "order_notes": order.notes_str,
                "is_cleared_order": True if order.cleared_order else False,  # it is either None or True, so need to coerce
                **order.context,
            }
            updated_orders.append(json.dumps(order_data, default=str).encode("utf-8"))

        if updated_orders:
            client = boto3.client("kinesis", region_name="eu-west-1")
            self._write_logs(client=client, data=updated_orders, write_table="cleared_orders_meta")```

elements.text:
def _process_cleared_orders(self, event):
        if event.event.orders:
            client = boto3.client("kinesis", region_name="eu-west-1")
            orders = [json.dumps(o.__dict__, default=str).encode("utf-8") for o in event.event.orders]
            self._write_logs(client=client, data=orders, write_table="cleared_orders")

    def _process_cleared_orders_meta(self, event):
        orders = event.event
        updated_orders = []
        for order in orders:
            if order.order_type.ORDER_TYPE == OrderTypes.LIMIT:
                size = order.order_type.size
            else:
                size = order.order_type.liability

            if order.order_type.ORDER_TYPE == OrderTypes.MARKET_ON_CLOSE:
                price = None
            else:
                price = order.order_type.price

            order_data = {
                "bet_id": order.bet_id,
                "market_id": order.market_id,
                "selection_id": order.selection_id,
                "trade_id": order.trade.id,
                "date_time_placed": order.responses.date_time_placed,
                "price": price,
                "price_matched": order.average_price_matched,
                "size": size,
                "size_matched": order.size_matched,
                "side": order.side,
                "market_type": order.market_type,
                "elapsed_seconds_executable": order.elapsed_seconds_executable,
                "customer_strategy_ref": order.trade.strategy.name,
                "order_status": order.status.value,
                "market_note": order.trade.market_notes,
                "trade_notes": order.trade.notes_str,
                "order_notes": order.notes_str,
                "is_cleared_order": True if order.cleared_order else False,  # it is either None or True, so need to coerce
                **order.context,
            }
            updated_orders.append(json.dumps(order_data, default=str).encode("utf-8"))

        if updated_orders:
            client = boto3.client("kinesis", region_name="eu-west-1")
            self._write_logs(client=client, data=updated_orders, write_table="cleared_orders_meta")

text:
```    def _write_logs(self, client, data: List[bytes], write_table: str):
        records = [{"Data": d, "PartitionKey": f"{self.log_prefix}{write_table}"} for d in data]
        for chunk in chunks(records, n=200):
            client.put_records(StreamName="LoggingStream", Records=chunk)```

text:
I think it comes back to <@UBS7QANF3>’s point, I hadn't been paying attention to the fact they were OU markets, these typically close in-play once the event has occurred (or shortly after I think), so once for example 3 goals have been scored the 2.5 goals market can settle and would therefore disappear.

Is it definitely not that?

text:
<@UFTBRB3F1> So, but in `trading.betting.list_events` I put a filter so that it only pulls event ids that contain at least some of the mentioned markets, correct?

So it wouldn't make sense for a game that started 0-0 or that is 2-1 to appear with a blank market return.

Detail, if I run every 1 second, for example, I think it would make more sense for failures of thousandths of difference to happen, but this happens by calling 1 time per minute, so it doesn't seem to me that it's a coincidence to always get it right at the time of the problem, must have some little detail that lasts for at least 1 minute or more (I think. Haha)

Or am I missing something because of my lack of knowledge?

text:
Tricky to say, it sounds like its probably as Mo suggested...but when you can try and see which particular markets this occurs on and for example if you notice its always markets that settle in game once an event occurs then it probably answers it....if not then at least we know its something else.

I'm not 100% on how the filter behaves for markets that are settled whilst the event is still live for football, but I would assume as soon as the market is closed that market_id drops out and wouldn't appear, but other markets (as you have a range of market types) would still appear, OVER_UNDER_85 for example presumably virtually always remains at a guess?

text: Possibly worth bearing in mind that these O/U markets are sometimes incorrectly/prematurely settled by Betfair when there is a VAR intervention. They might have got their act together a bit more recently but this is another element that may muddy the water for you

text: <@UUE6E1LA1>  thanks for support, in fact yes, I understand this point, but in the case only a specific market would not be delivered, the rest would be (it would be quite rare cases of games where all markets are marked as settled on account of VAR, we would not have 13 cases per day as I mentioned), an empty response would not come as if there was no market in the event. And the game I brought as an example, is from a German regional league, there is no VAR in the tournament. The case is really focused on a pattern that I will find out what it is during this week and I will bring the results of the test.
